allPosts.title: Ep #14: The Linux Incident
allPosts.author: Austin Webre & Clinton Walker
allPosts.excerpt: Clinton and Austin spend 20 minutes dicussing HHS Human Subject Regulation flow charts. They also discuss the much more interesting story behind how a dispute between Linux maintainers and a research group resulted in an entire university being banned from contributing to the largest open source project in the world.

allPosts.title: Ep #13: M1 Hype!
allPosts.author: Austin Webre & Clinton Walker
allPosts.excerpt: Clinton imagines a future Apple release without graphs and Austin worries his future Mac might burst into flames. It's also a detailed discussion about the architecture of the M1 and how Apple Silicon marks a shift back to Apple's roots.

allPosts.title: Ep #12: Design Patterns for Patternless Languages
allPosts.author: Austin Webre & Clinton Walker
allPosts.excerpt: On this not so spooky episode, Clinton does his best sports ball announcer voice and Austin reflects on a year's worth of episodes. They also wade into the debate over the usefullness of design patterns and whether modern languages have made them obsolete.

allPosts.title: Ep #11: Turing Completeness
allPosts.author: Austin Webre & Clinton Walker
allPosts.excerpt: After a breif hiatus, Clinton and Austin are back with a lengthy discussion of old technolgies made new and get in deep on the ways in which Turing Completeness shape the development landscape - from cyber security to language design.

allPosts.title: Ep #10: Automation
allPosts.author: Austin Webre & Clinton Walker
allPosts.excerpt: Clinton and Austin take a listener's advice and talk about automation and its effects on society and developers. Clinton exstoles the virtues of "putting everything in the cloud."

allPosts.title: Ep #9: Shillin' and Chillin'
allPosts.author: Austin Webre & Clinton Walker
allPosts.excerpt: Clinton and Austin dicuss recent developments in the .NET and Jetbrains spaces. Clinton shows off his sound design skills.

allPosts.title: Exploring MVU Part 2: Composition
allPosts.author: Austin Webre
allPosts.excerpt: So a couple days have come and gone and I'm still riding high on my experience with the MVU pattern. I'm struggling some with the syntax of F#, but I'm getting it bit by bit and even learning to love some aspects of it. That being said, the sample app I went through last time did nothing but peak my interest. It felt really smooth and easy to reason about, but "Counters" always are, right? So the next logical question is, how do we make this work for a more complicated situation?

allPosts.title: Exploring MVU and Functional Paradigms in Xamarin.Forms
allPosts.author: Austin Webre
allPosts.excerpt: This week saw one of Microsoft's biggest conferences transition to a completely online format. We won't discuss the fact that this year's conference was supposed to be held just 30 minutes from my house and that I was hoping to attend, but I do want to talk a bit about some of this year's announcements in the .NET space that have taken over my brain. There's plenty to be excited about - new Azure services, production-ready (?) Blazor, .NET Core 4 - err... I mean .NET 5 - but what has really monopolized my thinking is how functional concepts keep making their way into C#.

allPosts.title: Ep #8: Use Case Goes Remote
allPosts.author: Austin Webre & Clinton Walker
allPosts.excerpt: Clinton and Austin discuss how their handling this new all remote world. Clinton shares his dispair with living "in a box".

allPosts.title: Ep #7: Cheating at Design
allPosts.author: Austin Webre & Clinton Walker
allPosts.excerpt: Clinton and Austin discuss articles written by Adam Wathan and Steve Schoger about how to be design-minded developers. Please stay home, stay healthy, and try to stay sane.

allPosts.title: COVID-19, Merch, and the Future of Use Case
allPosts.author: Austin Webre
allPosts.excerpt: First off, we hope that everyone is managing to stay safe and sane amidst this pandemic. Our whole lives seem to have changed drastically over a span of just a few days and I know it can feel like a lot to take in. In times like these, its more important than ever to invest in community, so feel free to reach out to us @usecasepod on Twitter and usecasepod@gmail.com or by commenting below.

allPosts.title: Ep #6: Containers!
allPosts.author: Austin Webre & Clinton Walker
allPosts.excerpt: Clinton and Austin discuss the rise of Docker and how containers have changed development and infastructure. Clinton reminds us all of the dangers of tandem floats and Austin wishes everyone a safe and happy Mardis Gras.

allPosts.title: Mobile Updates to the Blog!
allPosts.author: Austin Webre
allPosts.excerpt: So recently, I finally got around to fixing the last couple of podcast platforms we had yet to join. It was at this point that I realized this site was missing something huge: links to our episodes on every platform! So I took some time to add links with brand images to the top nav, at which point I proudly message Clinton to get what I assumed would be resounding praise. Instead I got, "hmmm... they look too small."

allPosts.title: Ep #5: Agile and Scrum
allPosts.author: Austin Webre & Clinton Walker
allPosts.excerpt: Clinton and Austin shill some sweet Microsoft products and discuss how and why the tech industry is dropping Waterfall for Agile and Scrum. Lily borks... again.

allPosts.title: Hello World!
allPosts.author: Austin Webre
allPosts.excerpt: We're super excited to have launched this website for Use Case, but Clinton and I have a bigger vision for what this will be. We're hoping that in the coming months this will become a jumping off point for us to build a community around our little show. We started this project for the topics that we find interesting, but as it grows we want to find out more about our listeners and what you want.

allPosts.title: Ep #4: The Failure of PHP
allPosts.author: Austin Webre & Clinton Walker
allPosts.excerpt: On a very clickbait episode, Clinton and Austin discuss the internet's love/hate (but mostly hate) relationship with PHP.

allPosts.title: Ep #3: Functional Programming
allPosts.author: Austin Webre & Clinton Walker
allPosts.excerpt: Clinton and Austin talk about what Functional Programming is, how it compares to OOP and how Functional paradigms have made their way into Object Oriented languages. This month's Git Trendy also features special guest. Lily, a feisty Mini Schnauzer has something to say about DevOps - we're just not quite sure what.

allPosts.title: Ep #2: The State of Quantum Computing
allPosts.author: Austin Webre & Clinton Walker
allPosts.excerpt: Clinton and Austin give an overview of the state of Quantum Computing. They discuss what a Quantum Computer is, how it works, and the implications of Quantum Computing for developers.

allPosts.title: Ep #1: JVM vs CLR
allPosts.author: Austin Webre & Clinton Walker
allPosts.excerpt: On the inagural episode of Use Case, Clinton and Austin compare and contrast JVM and CLR. The discussion broadens to include all of the Java and .NET ecosystems as well as the approaches taken by the companies who support them.
